device-profile.mqtt-enable-compatibility-with-json-payl: Enable compatibility with other payload formats.

When enabled, the platform will use a Protobuf payload format by default. If parsing fails, the platform will attempt to use JSON payload format. Useful for backward compatibility during firmware updates. For example, the initial release of the firmware uses Json, while the new release uses Protobuf. During the process of firmware update for the fleet of devices, it is required to support both Protobuf and JSON simultaneously. The compatibility mode introduces slight performance degradation, so it is recommended to disable this mode once all devices are updated.
device-profile.mqtt-use-json-format-for-default-downlin: Use Json format for default downlink topics

When enabled, the platform will use Json payload format to push attributes and RPC via the following topics: v1/devices/me/attributes/response/$request_id, v1/devices/me/attributes, v1/devices/me/rpc/request/$request_id, v1/devices/me/rpc/response/$request_id. This setting does not impact attribute and rpc subscriptions sent using new (v2) topics: v2/a/res/$request_id, v2/a, v2/r/req/$request_id, v2/r/res/$request_id. Where $request_id is an integer request identifier.
device-profile.mqtt-send-ack-on-validation-exception: Send PUBACK on PUBLISH message validation failure
device-profile.mqtt-send-ack-on-validation-exception-hi: By default, the platform will close the MQTT session on message validation failure. When enabled, the platform will send publish acknowledgment instead of closing the session.

binding-type.u: U: Client is reachable via the UDP binding at any time.
binding-type.m: M: Client is reachable via the MQTT binding at any time.
binding-type.h: H: Client is reachable via the HTTP binding at any time.
binding-type.t: T: Client is reachable via the TCP binding at any time.
binding-type.s: S: Client is reachable via the SMS binding at any time.
binding-type.n: N: Client MUST send the response to such a request over the Non-IP binding (is supported since LWM2M 1.1).
binding-type.uq: UQ: UDP connection in queue mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)
binding-type.uqs: UQS: both UDP and SMS connections active; UDP in queue mode, SMS in standard mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)
binding-type.tq: TQ: TCP connection in queue mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)
binding-type.tqs: TQS: both TCP and SMS connections active; TCP in queue mode, SMS in standard mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)

lwm2m.binding-tooltip:
This is the list in the"binding" resource of the LwM2M server object - /1/x/7.
Indicates the supported binding modes in the LwM2M Client.
This value SHOULD be the same as the value in the “Supported Binding and Modes” resource in the Device Object (/3/0/16).
While multiple transports are supported, only one transport binding can be used during the entire Transport Session.
As an example, when UDP and SMS are both supported, the LwM2M Client and the LwM2M Server can choose to communicate either over UDP or SMS during the entire Transport Session.

gateway.JSON-hint: Converter for this payload type processes MQTT messages in JSON format. It uses JSON Path expressions to extract vital details such as device names, device profile names, attributes, and time series from the message. And regular expressions to get device details from topics.
gateway.bytes-hint: Converter for this payload type designed for binary MQTT payloads, this converter directly interprets binary data to retrieve device names and device profile names, along with attributes and time series, using specific byte positions for data extraction.
gateway.custom-hint: This option allows you to use a custom converter for specific data tasks. You need to add your custom converter to the extension folder and enter its class name in the UI settings. Any keys you provide will be sent as configuration to your custom converter.

gateway.data-mapping-hint: Data mapping provides the capability to parse and convert the data received from a MQTT client in incoming messages into specific attributes and time series data keys.

gateway.device-node-hint: Path or identifier for device node on OPC UA server. Relative paths from it for attributes and time series can be used.
gateway.extension-hint: Put your converter classname in the field. Custom converter with such class should be in extension/mqtt folder.

hints.modbus-master: Configuration sections for connecting to Modbus servers and reading data from them.
hints.modbus-server: Configuration section for the Modbus server, storing data and sending updates to the platform when changes occur or at fixed intervals.
hints.remote-configuration: Enables remote configuration and management of the gateway
hints.remote-shell: Enables remote control of the operating system with the gateway from the Remote Shell widget
hints.host: Hostname or IP address of platform server
hints.port: Port of MQTT service on platform server
hints.token: Access token for the gateway from platform server
hints.client-id: MQTT client id for the gateway form platform server
hints.username: MQTT username for the gateway form platform server
hints.password: MQTT password for the gateway form platform server
hints.data-folder: Path to the folder that will contain data (Relative or Absolute)
hints.remote-log: Enables remote logging and logs reading from the gateway
hints.backup-count: If backup count is > 0, when a rollover is done, no more than backup count files are kept - the oldest ones are deleted
hints.storage: Provides configuration for saving incoming data before it is sent to the platform
hints.max-file-count: Maximum number of files that will be created
hints.max-read-count: Number of messages to retrieve from the storage and send to platform
hints.max-records: Maximum count of records that will be stored in one file
hints.read-record-count: Number of messages to retrieve from the storage and send to platform
hints.max-records-count: Maximum number of data entries in storage before sending to platform
hints.ttl-check-hour: How often will the Gateway check data for obsolescence
hints.ttl-messages-day: Maximum number of days that the storage will retain data
hints.command: The result of the command execution, will be used as the value for telemetry
hints.check-device-activity: Enables monitor the activity of each connected device
hints.inactivity-timeout: Time after whose the gateway will disconnect device
hints.minimal-pack-delay: Delay between sending packs of messages (Decreasing this setting results in increased CPU usage)
hints.qos: Quality of Service in MQTT messaging (0 - at most once, 1 - at least once)
hints.server-port: Network port on which GRPC server will listen for incoming connections.
hints.grpc-keep-alive-timeout: Maximum time the server should wait for a keepalive ping response before considering the connection dead.
hints.grpc-keep-alive: Duration between two successive keepalive ping messages when there is no active RPC call.
hints.grpc-min-time-between-pings: Minimum amount of time the server should wait between sending keepalive ping messages
hints.grpc-max-pings-without-data: Maximum number of keepalive ping messages that the server can send without receiving any data before it considers the connection dead.
hints.grpc-min-ping-interval-without-data: Minimum amount of time the server should wait between sending keepalive ping messages when there is no data being sent or received.
hints.permit-without-calls: Allow server to keep the GRPC connection alive even when there are no active RPC calls.
hints.memory: Your data will be stored in the in-memory queue, it is a fastest but no persistence guarantee.
hints.file: Your data will be stored in separated files and will be saved even after the gateway restart.
hints.sqlite: Your data will be stored in file based database. And will be saved even after the gateway restart.
hints.opc-timeout: Timeout in milliseconds for connecting to OPC-UA server.
hints.security-policy: Security Policy defines the security mechanisms to be applied.
hints.scan-period: Period in milliseconds to rescan the server.
hints.sub-check-period: Period to check the subscriptions in the OPC-UA server.
hints.enable-subscription: If true - the gateway will subscribe to interesting nodes and wait for data update and if false - the gateway will rescan OPC-UA server every scanPeriodInMillis.
hints.method-name: Name of method on OPC-UA server.
hints.arguments: Arguments for the method (will be overwritten by arguments from the RPC request).
hints.poll-period: Period in milliseconds to read data from nodes.

modbus.framer-type: Type of a framer (Socket, RTU, or ASCII), if needed.
modbus.host: Hostname or IP address of Modbus server.
modbus.connection-timeout: Connection timeout (in seconds) for the Modbus server.
modbus.word-order: Word order when reading multiple registers.
modbus.retries: Retrying data transmission to the master. Acceptable values: true or false.
modbus.retries-on-empty: Retry sending data to the master if the data is empty.
modbus.retries-on-invalid: Retry sending data to the master if it fails.
modbus.poll-period: Period in milliseconds to check attributes and telemetry on the slave.
modbus.connect-attempt-time: A waiting period in milliseconds before establishing a connection to the master.
modbus.connect-attempt-count: The number of connection attempts made through the gateway.
modbus.wait-after-failed-attempts: A waiting period in milliseconds before attempting to send data to the master.
modbus.baudrate: Baud rate for the serial device.
modbus.stopbits: The number of stop bits sent after each character in a message to indicate the end of the byte.
modbus.bytesize: The number of bits in a byte of serial data. This can be one of 5, 6, 7, or 8.
modbus.parity: The type of checksum used to verify data integrity. Options: (E)ven, (O)dd, (N)one.
modbus.key: Key to be used as the attribute key for the platform instance.
modbus.data-keys: For more information about function codes and data types click on help icon
modbus.modifier: The retrieved value will be adjusted (by multiplying or dividing it) based on the specified modifier value.

step1.title: Создание арендатора и администратора арендатора
step1.content:
Арендатор - это физическое лицо или организация, которая владеет или производит устройства и активы. У арендатора может быть несколько пользователей, клиентов, устройств и активов.

Администратор арендатора может создавать и управлять устройствами, активами, клиентами и информационными панелями в учетной записи арендатора.

Следуйте документации о том, как это сделать:
step1.how-to-create-tenant: Как создать арендатора и администратора арендатора

step2.title: Настроить функцию: Почтовый сервер
step2.content:
Настройка почтового сервера необходима для активации пользователей, восстановления пароля и доставки тревожных уведомлений.

Следуйте документации о том, как это сделать:

step3.title: Настроить функцию: SMS-провайдер
step3.content:
Настройте SMS-провайдера для оповещения клиентов о тревогах по SMS.

Следуйте документации о том, как это сделать:

step4.title: Настроить функцию: 2FA
step4.content:
Улучшите безопасность учетных записей платформы с помощью двухфакторной аутентификации.

Следуйте документации о том, как это сделать:

step5.title: Настройте функцию: OAuth 2
step5.content:
Упростите вход для пользователей арендаторов и клиентов с помощью функции единого входа через OAuth 2.0.

Следуйте документации о том, как это сделать:

step6.title: Настройте функцию: Slack
step6.content:
Распределите уведомления среди пользователей арендатора и клиента через Slack в соответствии с установленными правилами уведомлений.

Следуйте документации о том, как это сделать:

step1.title: Создать устройство
step1.content: Давайте подключим ваше первое устройство к платформе через UI. Следуйте документации о том, как это сделать:

step2.title: Подключите устройство
step2.content-before:
To connect the device you need to get the device credentials. We recommend using default auto-generated credentials which is access token for this guide.

  • Go to device table
  • Click on the device row to open device details
  • Press the button "Copy access token"

Use simple commands to publish data over HTTP. Don't forget to replace $ACCESS_TOKEN with your device access token:

windows.install-curl: Starting Windows 10 b17063, cURL is available by default.

step2.content-after:
You can also use other protocols such as MQTT, CoAP, etc.

Follow the documentation on how to do it:

step3.title: Создать дашборд
step3.content:
Создайте приборную панель для визуализации данных из таких сущностей, как активы, устройства и т. д.

Следуйте документации о том, как это сделать:

step4.title: Настройте правила оповещения
step4.content: Давайте подадим сигналы оповещения, когда температура достигнет 25 °C. Следуйте документации о том, как это сделать:

step5.title: Создайте оповещение
step5.content-before: To trigger the alarm, send a new telemetry value of 26°C or higher.
step5.content-after: Follow the documentation on how to do it:

step6.title: Создать клиента и назначить панели управления
step6.content:
Создавая панель конечного пользователя, пользователь клиента может видеть только свои устройства, а данные другого клиента будут скрыты.

Следуйте документации о том, как это сделать:
step6.how-to-create-customer-and-assign-dashbo: Как создать дашборд клиентов и назначений
